Description: Sherd of wall of North Ionian pottery bowl; interior glazed with two added red bands lined in white; exterior slipped cream; parts of three friezes preserved, divided by black bands with added red bands lined in white; slight traces of feet and filling ornament in upper frieze; in central frieze procession of wild goats to right: on left part of head, turned back, in centre complete animal, to right rear of third; added red on bodies; mixed filling ornament; in lower frieze one palmette preserved, with some petals in added red; dot rosettes as fill.
Curator's comments: Walter-Karydi (1973, no.982, pl. 121) publishes as a plate, erroneously.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VIII, no. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.105)
